channel.title: PI Memory leak
channel.description:
Hello, theres a memory leak on PI(Project Insanity), when i turn it on on my vps (2gb ram), it starts eating up ram untill it runs out and crashes. (starts at around 1.2gb then goes up to 2gb).
A strange thing is that when i put it up using WINE, it isn't eating memory up. But emulating java on a linux is just stupid and i want this fixed. I'll be monitoring this topic closely so post what ever comes to your mind, i'll give the files.

item.title: PI Memory leak
item.dc:creator: @PEN_R PEN()R
item.description:
@PEN_R wrote:

Scape-JAVA:

Pen()r, Grahams event manager is missing a switch statement.

i turned it off by commenting EventHandler.initialize(); in server.java , could it still fuck with my server?

Read full topic

item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

Pen()r, Grahams event manager is missing a switch statement.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Memory leak
item.dc:creator: @PEN_R PEN()R
item.description:
@PEN_R wrote:

eventmanager didn’t fix the problem. Looking for more answers

Read full topic

item.title: PI Memory leak
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

It’s a replacement for the process method, it makes it so people don’t add all kinds of timers to the process method which in turn makes processing longer which in turn will cause the server to be less stable and more likely to crash from not having enough memory allocated…

Read full topic

Pen()r, Have more respect. Paying for service isn’t allowed.

ps, it’s Graham event manager, well part of the problem anyway.

if that’s true, i love you.
[/quote]

It most likely is Grahams event manager, but Idk. Did Lmc use the event manager from Hyperion or from Grahams topic?[/quote]

going to test it in a few hours. what useful stuff does the eventmanager do anyways?

Read full topic
